Title: CoCoNet: A Collaborative Convolutional Network
Author: Brendan McCane1
University
Steven Mills1
Otago
Computer Science
Indian Statistical Institute
Umapada
Abstract: b' n nWe present an end to end CNN architecture for  xef xac x  ne grained visual recognition called Collaborative Convo  nlutional Network  CoCoNet   The network uses a collaborative  xef xac x  lter after the convolutional layers to represent nan image as an optimal weighted collaboration of features learned from training samples as a whole rather than none at a time  This gives CoCoNet more power to encode the  xef xac x  ne grained nature of the data with limited sam  nples in an end to end fashion  We perform a detailed study of the performance with   stage and   stage transfer nlearning and di xef xac x  erent con xef xac x  gurations with benchmark architectures like AlexNet and VggNet  The ablation study nshows that the proposed method outperforms its constituent parts considerably and consistently  CoCoNet also noutperforms the baseline popular deep learning based  xef xac x  ne grained recognition method  namely Bilinear CNN n BCNN  with statistical signi xef xac x  cance  Experiments have been performed on the  xef xac x  ne grained species recognition nproblem  but the method is general enough to be applied to other similar tasks  Lastly  we also introduce a new npublic dataset for  xef xac x  ne grained species recognition  that of Indian endemic birds and have reported initial results non it  The training metadata and new dataset are available through the corresponding author  n n  '
